title: Sweet Potato Pie
description: Shared from a Southern recipe, this homemade sweet potato pie is easy to make with boiled sweet potato. Try it, it may just be the best you've ever tasted!
instructions: Place whole sweet potato in pot and cover with water; bring to a boil. Boil until tender when pierced with a fork, 40 to 50 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Remove sweet potato from the pot and run under cold water. Remove and discard skin.

Break sweet potato flesh apart and place in a bowl. Add butter and mix with an electric mixer until well combined. Add sugar, milk, eggs, nutmeg, cinnamon, and vanilla; beat on medium speed until mixture is smooth. Pour filling into unbaked pie crust.
Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, 55 to 60 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool before serving.

title: Coq au Vin
description: A classic French dish of chicken braised in red wine with mushrooms and pearl onions.
ingredients: 1 (3 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces
instructions: Melt butter in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Brown chicken pieces on all sides, about 5 minutes per side.
Pour brandy over chicken and ignite with a long match. Let flames burn out.
Add red wine, stock, garlic, bay leaves, and thyme. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and simmer for 1 hour.
Add pearl onions and mushrooms, simmer uncovered for 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.

title: Pad Thai
description: A popular Thai noodle dish with shrimp, eggs, and bean sprouts.
instructions: Soak rice noodles in water for 30 minutes, then drain.
In a small bowl, combine tamarind paste, fish sauce, and sugar.
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Stir-fry garlic until fragrant, about 10 seconds.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 2 minutes.
Push ingredients to the side, crack eggs into wok and scramble.
Add noodles and tamarind sauce, toss until combined.
Stir in bean sprouts and green onions.
Serve topped with peanuts and lime wedges.
